definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee

sentences.english: Article 66 The trustee of a public trust must not resign without the approval of the regulatory agency of public undertakings.
sentences.chinese: 信託的受託人未經公益事業管理機構批准，不得辭任。

sentences.english: The second chapter represents the basic fiduciary duties of the plan trustees.
sentences.chinese: 第二章是美國員工持股計劃受託人的基本信義義務。

sentences.english: The trustee must obey and carry out be directions of the settlor.
sentences.chinese: 受託人必須遵守並執行財產贈與人的指示。

sentences.english: This insurance shall not inure to the benefit of the carrier or other bailee.
sentences.chinese: 本保險的權益承運人或其他受託人不得享受。

sentences.english: Trustee income will be attributed only to settlors of a trust.
sentences.chinese: 受託人收入將只歸咎於信託財產授予者。

sentences.english: Where there are other provisions in this Law governing the resignation of the trustee of a public welfare trust, those provisions shall prevail.
sentences.chinese: 本法對公益信託的受託人辭任另有規定的，從其規定。

sentences.english: The third chapter focuses the fiduciary duties of plan trustee in face of tender offer.
sentences.chinese: 第三章是面臨要約收購時計劃受託人的信義義務。

sentences.english: I try to reach the trustee every day.
sentences.chinese: 我每天都在聯繫破產受託人。

sentences.english: It is illegal for a fiduciary to misappropriate money for personal gain.
sentences.chinese: 受託人爲了個人利益挪用金錢是不合法的。

sentences.english: The delivery of personal property in trust by the bailor to the bailee.
sentences.chinese: 寄託人出於信任把個人財產移交給受託人。

definition: to repay a debt in full/to redeem/to clear

pinyin: gu3 dong1 te4 bie2 da4 hui4

definition: to bear joint responsibility for sth/joint liability (law)
to conclude (treaty, contract, agreement etc)/to set up (a rule etc)
